troubleshooting.title: Blinking printer lights
troubleshooting.shortdesc: The printer indicator lights are blinking, and you are unable to print.

condition.p: The printer indicator lights are blinking and you are unable to print.

diagnostics-general.p: Use the following table to diagnose the problem.

strow.stentry: The printer is preparing to print. No action is required. The light will stop flashing when the printer has received all data.
Printer is stalled and needs to be restarted. See .

ul.li: Connection light: Flashes for five seconds
Error light: Flashes for five seconds

strow.stentry: The printer has lost connection with the camera while printing. Unplug and replug the camera.
The camera is not set to the correct mode for transferring photos. Change the camera mode.
An unsupported device, such as a mouse, has been connected to the front USB port. Disconnect the unsupported device.

step.cmd: Turn off the printer.
Remove the rear access door by pressing the handle to the right and pulling out the door.
Remove any paper that is inside the printer by pulling the paper out from the back of the printer.
Replace the rear access door.
If the paper jam cannot be removed from the back of the printer, raise the printer cover, remove the paper jam from the front of the printer, and then lower the cover.
Turn on the printer and print the document again.
Press the Power button to turn off the printer, and then press the Power button to restart the printer.
step.info: Proceed to step 2 if the lights continue to flash.

step.cmd: Press the Power button to turn off the printer.
Disconnect the printer power cord from the electrical outlet.
Reconnect the printer power cord to the electrical outlet.
Press the Power button to turn on the printer.
Raise the printer cover, remove the print cartridge on the right, and then lower the cover.
Follow one of these steps.

choices.choice: If the light is flashing: Open the printer cover, replace the print cartridge that you removed, and then remove the other print cartridge. Proceed to step 3.
If the light is off: There is a problem with the print cartridge that you removed. Proceed to step 3.

step.cmd: Manually clean the print cartridge.
After cleaning the print cartridge, reinsert it into the printer. If the light continues to flash, replace the print cartridge.
Turn on the printer.
Make sure to load the printer with plain, white paper.
Gently grasp the handles on either side of the printer and raise the ink cartridge access door until it locks in place.
step.stepresult: The carriage moves to the center of the printer.

step.cmd: Wait until the carriage is idle and silent before you proceed.
Lift the lid on the ink cartridge slot, then gently push the lid back until it stops.
Pull up on the ink cartridge to remove it from the slot.
Remove one of the new ink cartridges from its package, being careful to touch only the black plastic on the cartridge.
Remove the plastic tape from the ink cartridge.

info.note: Do not touch the copper-colored contacts or the ink nozzles. Do not replace the protective tape on the contacts. Handling these parts can result in clogs, ink failure, and bad electrical connections.

step.cmd: Hold the ink cartridge by its sides with the nozzles toward the printer, then slide the ink cartridge forward into the slot.
Close the lid on the ink cartridge slot to secure the ink cartridge in place.
Repeat the previous steps to install the other ink cartridge if necessary.
Close the ink cartridge access door.
step.stepresult: The printer automatically prints an alignment page.

step.cmd: Wait for the alignment page to fully eject from the printer.
Lift the scanner lid.
Place the alignment page with the print side down on the scanner glass according to the engraved guides around the glass.
Close the scanner lid and touch OK.
step.stepresult: The printer aligns the ink cartridges.
